sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A treatise of monarchie, containing two parts: 1. concerning monarchy in generall. 2. concerning this particular monarchy. Wherein all the maine questions occurrent in both, are stated, disputed, and determined: and in the close, the contention now in being, is moderately debated, and the readiest meanes of reconcilement proposed. Done by an earnest desirer of his countries peace. Hunton, Philip, 1604?-1682.
[6], 79, [1]p.
Printed for John Bellamy, and Ralph Smith, and are to be sold at the three golden Lions in Corn-hill, London : Anno Dom. 1643.
Attributed to Philip Hunton. Reproduction of the original in the British Library. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May 24th".
=======

Done by an earnest desirer of his countries peace. Hunton, Philip, 1604?-1682.
